libcsce.parser module¶

class libcsce.parser.CobaltStrikeConfigParser(source, version, disable_decryption=False, decryption_threshold=None)¶

Bases: object

Cobalt Strike Beacon config parser.

Supports parsing both encrypted and/or encoded Beacon configs from PE files (DLL/EXE) and memory dumps taken from systems where a Beacon was running. Currently, Beacons generated using CobaltStrike versions 3.x and 4.x (latest major version) can be decrypted and decoded. The class should be used as a context manager if parsing from a file on disk, as that will ensure it closes any file handles before exiting. If parsing from a buffer (libcsce.typing.ConfigBuffer) using as a context manager is not necessary.

Parameters

  • source (Union[bytearray, bytes, Path]) – buffer containing, or file path pointing to, PE file or memory dump

  • version (int) – Cobalt Strike version (must be one of CobaltStrikeConfigParser.SUPPORTED_VERSIONS)

  • disable_decryption (bool) – disable decryption attempt of Beacon config data

  • decryption_threshold (Optional[int]) – override the threshold used during decryption key search (see: CobaltStrikeConfigParser.gen_config_from_encrypted())

Variables

version – Cobalt Strike version (must be one of CobaltStrikeConfigParser.SUPPORTED_VERSIONS)

Examples

Parse config from Beacon file on disk:

>>> from pathlib import Path
>>> from libcsce import CobaltStrikeConfigParser
>>> with CobaltStrikeConfigParser(Path("testdata/exe-sample-01.bin"), 4) as beacon:
...     config = beacon.parse_config()
>>> config["dns-beacon"]["dns_idle"]
'0.0.0.0'

Read Beacon to buffer then parse config:

>>> from pathlib import Path
>>> from libcsce import CobaltStrikeConfigParser
>>> beacon_buffer = Path("testdata/exe-sample-01.bin").read_bytes()
>>> beacon = CobaltStrikeConfigParser(beacon_buffer, 4)
>>> config = beacon.parse_config()
>>> config["dns-beacon"]["dns_idle"]
'0.0.0.0'
DECODED_SIGNATURE: bytes = b'\x00\x01\x00\x01\x00\x02..\x00\x02\x00\x01\x00\x02..\x00'¶

Decoded Beacon config signature. Used to verify that decryption and/or decoding worked successfully.

DEFAULT_DECRYPTION_THRESHOLD: int = 1100¶

Default for minimum occurrences of decryption key in encrypted Beacon config (see: CobaltStrikeConfigParser.gen_config_from_encrypted()).

ENCODED_SIGNATURES: Dict[int, bytes] = {3: b'ihihik..ikihik..ij', 4: b'././.,...,./.,...'}¶

Encoded Beacon config signatures for each supported Beacon version. Use to detect encoded config data during the parsing process (see: CobaltStrikeConfigParser.gen_config_from_encoded()).

ENCODE_XOR_KEYS: Dict[int, int] = {3: 105, 4: 46}¶

Static encoding keys for each supported Beacon version.

SIZE: int = 4096¶

Size in bytes of the config data.

SUPPORTED_VERSIONS: Set[int] = {3, 4}¶

Set of supported Beacon versions.

classmethod gen_config_from_decoded(source_buffer)¶

Generate config data buffer from decoded Beacon.

This function should be used after decrypting and/or decoding the Beacon config data using CobaltStrikeConfigParser.gen_config_from_encrypted() and CobaltStrikeConfigParser.gen_config_from_encoded().

Parameters

source_buffer (Union[bytearray, bytes, mmap]) – buffer to extract Beacon config data from

Return type

Union[bytearray, bytes, None]

Returns

If the decoded config data signature is found, buffer containing config data, otherwise None.

classmethod gen_config_from_encoded(source_buffer, version)¶

Decode config data from the provided buffer.

Cobalt Strike can encode Beacon config data with a static key, which depends on the version (see: CobaltStrikeConfigParser.ENCODE_XOR_KEYS). Each version also has a distinct signature for encoded data (see: CobaltStrikeConfigParser.ENCODED_SIGNATURES), which this function uses to determine the data offset. This function should be used after decrypting config data with CobaltStrikeConfigParser.gen_config_from_encrypted(), if necessary.

Parameters

  • source_buffer (Union[bytearray, bytes, mmap]) – buffer to decode Beacon config data from

  • version (int) – Cobalt Strike version

Return type

Union[bytearray, bytes, None]

Returns

If the encoded config data signature is found, buffer containing decoded config data, otherwise None.

classmethod gen_config_from_encrypted(source_buffer, threshold=None)¶

Decrypt config data from the .data section of a PE file.

The .data section in Beacon PE files are often much larger than CobaltStrikeConfigParser.SIZE. Since XOR-ing with 0x00 produces the identity, a large portion of the .data section turns out to be the randomly-generated XOR key. This function exploits that fact to find the key by counting the number of occurrences of each 4-byte sequence in the section, and choosing the sequence that occurs at least threshold times. Empirically the number of occurrences for the this sequence is much larger than the second most frequent sequence (hundreds more), and significantly larger than the third, fourth, fifth, etc. RomanEmelyanov’s parser on GitHub provides another way to decrypt Beacon configs from non-PE files. This method will likely be included once it’s understood more and can be tested.

Parameters

  • source_buffer (Union[bytearray, bytes, mmap]) – buffer to decrypt Beacon config data from

  • threshold (Optional[int]) – override the threshold used during decryption key search

Return type

Union[bytearray, bytes, None]

Returns

If an encryption key is found, new buffer containing the decrypted config data, otherwise None.

gen_config_from_source()¶

Decrypt and/or decode Beacon config data from the provided source.

This function works in three steps:

  1. If decryption isn’t disabled, attempt to decrypt the Beacon config data.

  2. Search the decoded data signature and, if found, return the decoded data.

  3. Otherwise, attempt to decode the config data and return it.

Return type

Union[bytearray, bytes]

Returns

If decryption and/or decoding were successful, buffer containing Beacon config data, otherwise None

Raises

ConfigNotFoundError – No config data identified after decryption and/or decoding

parse_config()¶

Parse Beacon config settings.

Uses CobaltStrikeConfigParser.gen_config_from_source() to extract the Beacon config data and parse the settings using libcsce.setting.BeaconSettings.

Return type

Dict[str, Any]

Returns

Dictionary containing config settings
